page_analysis.text_content:
Daylight plane

The daylight plane in conjunction with the setbacks & height limits, create an invisible tent

intended to contain development on the lot in a way that preserves privacy and exposure to natural light.

Code sections
Page 26
18.12.040 (a) Table 2
Page 27
18.04
Page 28
18.12.040 (c) Table 2
Page 29
18.12.050 (b) (2)
18.12.040 (i)

Primary daylight plane (sides)

The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area. Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.

Fig 20 Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane

Max. allowed is Min. required by Building Code

45°

10' from average grade

Average grade

Grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot

Existing grade of the structure (at midpoint of wall)

Side lot line

24' max. for protrusions

Max. building height

Side lot line

Notes:

• Daylight plane is measured from average grade.

• Average grade is established using existing grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42)

• Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.

• Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

visual_elements.description: Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane with a house illustration. The diagram includes a dashed line representing the daylight plane at a 45° angle starting 10 feet above average grade. Vertical measurements indicate a maximum of 24 feet for protrusions and a maximum building height. Labels show average grade, grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot, existing grade of the structure at midpoint of wall, and side lot lines on both sides of the house.
visual_elements.location: Middle to right side of the page

visual_elements.description: Small 3D wireframe illustration of an invisible tent shape representing the daylight plane concept.
visual_elements.location: Left sidebar, below the text 'The daylight plane in conjunction with the setbacks & height limits, create an invisible tent'

technical_specifications.parameter: Height from average grade to start of daylight plane

technical_specifications.value: Not explicitly stated numerically in this image

additional_notes: Page number 26 at bottom left corner.
Left sidebar with grey background contains explanatory text and code section references.
No handwritten annotations or stamps visible.
Text and diagram are clear and legible.
cross_references: Code sections referenced: 18.12.040 (a) Table 2 (Page 26), 18.04 (Page 27), 18.12.040 (c) Table 2 (Page 28), 18.12.050 (b) (2) and 18.12.040 (i) (Page 29).
Reference to 'See Fig 44 p. 42' for average grade establishment.

qualifiers.text: The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area.
Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.

conditions.text: Daylight plane is measured from average grade.
Average grade is established using existing grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42)
conditions.threshold_value: existing grade before grading or fill

conditions.text: Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

logical_relationships.expression: Daylight plane measurement requires average grade measurement AND average grade established using existing grade AND side daylight plane measured at lot line AND rear daylight plane measured at rear setback.

execution_sequence.action: Establish average grade using existing grade before any grading or fill.
Measure daylight plane from average grade.
Measure side daylight plane upwards at lot line.
Measure rear daylight plane upwards at rear setback.
